name: whispery
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a low sound like a whisper (= a way of speaking very quietly, using the breath but not the voice): You can barely hear the singer's whispery vocals over the guitar and drums. She had been ill with laryngitis, so her voice was little more than a whispery croak.
More examplesFewer examplesHe approached my desk and asked in a whispery voice if I had heard the latest rumour. She made a whispery confession of her sins to the priest, who told her that God was ready to forgive her. I could hear whispery music coming through his earbuds.
